text: Hey all, does anyone know of a way to create a dnd_section with the ability for the editor to choose a video for the background? The idea being that a user could add this section to a page, choose a video for the background (or input a url), and then be able to have the drag and drop functionality of a standard section.

Hi <@U07FRARFZS7> that document is really helpful. It wasn't the module_attribute but the content_attribute a little below on the page that did the trick! I guess it's more commonly used for email_body but it worked perfectly for post_body. This was a HUGE help! Thanks so much!

Hello everyone! I am trying to utilize page level variables set as: `{% boolean "showActivateButton" value="true" label="Show Activate button in navigation" export_to_template_context=True %}`  in my base.html template and reaching it in a page header through both `content.widgets` or `widget_data`  like: `{% set show_activate_button = content.widgets.showActivateButton.body.value == true %}`  . When I create a new page I see on a page level that value is checked (true), but in the page header I see only empty object for content.widgets. It appears if I manually retrigger the value and update the page. Am I missing something here? Why for me the `content.widgets` is empty initially?

Although actually it shows the default text in the template preview, but it doesn't show the default text when I actually create a new blog post with the template. I think this might just be a quirk of the theme we're using :woman-shrugging: I'm happy I got it in the template though!
Strange, but yes - at least good that editor will see it - I do think `content_attribute` is only email thing overal
Yeah weird. The field is content.post_body so I think that's why content_attribute worked, but maybe module attribute could've worked better. I'll keep playing with it!
